metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000001 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high
metadata.Description:
In glibc 2.26 and earlier there is confusion in the usage of getcwd() byrealpath() which can be used to write before the destination buffer leadingto a buffer underflow and potential code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
libc-bin - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
libc6 - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-amd64 - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-armel - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-i386 - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-pic - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-s390 - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-x32 - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
locales - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
locales-all - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
multiarch-support - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
nscd - 2.26-0ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

musl - 1.1.19-1
musl-tools - 1.1.19-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26-0ubuntu2.1').
musl package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.19-1').
